Find a Course Find a University Blog Log in Sign Up Sign Up Home> UK Study in Premium UK Universities From Application to Arriaval: Studytez Supports Your UK Journey Top 500 QS World University Rankings 2 Years Graduate Visa (PSW) Â£13kâ€“Â£35k Annual Tuition Fees Up to Â£10,000 Scholarship on Tuition Fees 600K+ International Students Why Study in the UK for Indian Students? Qualifications from the United Kingdom are recognised and respected worldwide. In the QS World University Rankings 2022, the UK proudly features 90 universities, including 4 in the worldâ€™s top 10. Studying in the UK means you gain not just a degree, but a globally valued qualification that enhances your career prospects and earning potential. With world-class Russell Group Universities, leading public research institutions, and highly ranked colleges, the UK offers a dynamic, innovative, and intellectually challenging environment to help you achieve your academic and professional goals. Admission Requirement Diploma A minimum level of educational qualification is required, usually equivalent to the completion of secondary education or its international equivalent. A minimum IELTS score of 6.0 and above, TOEFL - 72 to 100, and CAE - 180 to 230 is required. Bachelor's Typically, you will need to have completed secondary education or its international equivalent, such as A-levels, an IB Diploma, or equivalent qualifications from your country. A minimum IELTS score of 6.0 to 7.5,TOEFL - 72 to 100, and CAE - 180 to 230 is required. Master's You will need a Bachelor's degree or its international equivalent from a recognized institution. The required grade or classification may vary depending on the university and program. A minimum IELTS score of 6.5 to 7.5, TOEFL - 90 to 100, and CAE - 180 to 230 is required. Doctorate You must hold a Master's degree or an equivalent qualification, such as an MPhil (Master of Philosophy), from a recognized institution. Some universities may accept exceptional candidates with a Bachelor's degree, provided they have relevant research experience or achievements. You are usually required to submit a research proposal outlining the topic, objectives, methodology, and potential outcomes of your proposed research project. This proposal demonstrates your ability to conduct independent research and contribute to the field. A minimum score of 6.5 to 7.0 in IELTS, TOEFL - 90 to 100, and PTE - 58 to 65 is required. Some universities may conduct interviews as part of the admissions process to assess your suitability for the program and your ability to carry out independent research. Exams Required to Study at UK Universities To study at UK universities, international students typically need to meet certain academic requirements and demonstrate their English language proficiency. Here are the main exams and qualifications commonly required: English Language Proficiency Exams: International English Language Testing System (IELTS) Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) Pearson Test of English (PTE) Cambridge English Qualifications (such as CAE or CPE) Intake Fall Intake(September - October): This is the primary intake period for most courses at UK universities. The autumn intake aligns with the start of the academic year in the UK, which usually begins in September or October. The majority of undergraduate and postgraduate programs start during this period. Students applying for the autumn intake usually need to submit their applications well in advance, typically by January or February of the same year for undergraduate courses, and earlier for some postgraduate programs. Winter Intake(January â€“ February): Some universities in the UK offer a smaller number of courses with a spring intake, particularly at the postgraduate level. The spring intake provides an opportunity for students who missed the autumn intake deadlines or who prefer to start their studies at a different time of the year. While less common than the autumn intake, the spring intake still offers a range of options for students, especially for certain specialized courses or programs. Summer: Summer: It is from April and May. Not all universities and courses have this intake. The pool of applicants is smaller than the first two intakes.However, due to this, students have a better chance of getting in. Cost UK tuition fees vary for the four countries: England, Scotland, Wales,and Northern Ireland. The cost of studying in the UK depends on the university and the type of program you choose. Studying in the UK offers a high return on investment (ROI). The cost of studying in the United Kingdom is comparatively lower than in the USA and Australia. UK university fees depend on the type of university. Tuition fees are higher in private universities compared to public universities. International students can expect tuition fees between Â£10,000 - Â£30,000 annually. The average living expenses might range from Â£800 to Â£2,300 per month, including accommodation, food, rent, and other costs. Degree Cost in GBP(Per Year) Cost in INR(Per Year) Undergraduate (Bachelor's) Â£10,000 - Â£30,000 â‚¹9,50,000 - â‚¹28,50,000 Postgraduate (Master's) Â£12,000 - Â£35,000 â‚¹11,40,000 - â‚¹33,25,000 MBA Â£15,000 - Â£60,000 â‚¹14,25,000 - â‚¹57,00,000 PhD Â£13,000 - Â£27,000 â‚¹12,35,000 - â‚¹25,65,000 Visa Requirements UK Student Visa Requirements: Acceptance to a Course Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies (CAS): Obtain a CAS from a licensed Tier 4 sponsor. The CAS is a unique reference number provided by your university or college, confirming that you have been accepted onto a course. Financial Requirements Course Fees: Proof that you can pay for your course fees for the first year of study. Living Costs: Proof that you have sufficient funds to cover your living costs for up to nine months. The amount required depends on the location of your university: Inside London: Â£1,483 per month Outside London: Â£1,136 per month Bank Statements: Bank statements, financial sponsorship letters, or evidence of educational loans to show you have the required funds. English Language Proficiency Test Scores: Provide proof of English language proficiency through approved tests like IELTS, TOEFL, or equivalent, unless you are exempt (e.g., you are from an English-speaking country or have a degree taught in English). Immigration Health Surcharge (IHS) IHS Payment: Pay the Immigration Health Surcharge to access the UKâ€™s National Health Service (NHS). The cost is typically Â£470 per year for students. Tuberculosis Test TB Test: If you are from a country where you must take the tuberculosis test, provide a certificate confirming you are free from TB. Valid Passport Passport: A valid passport or travel document. Ensure your passport is valid for the duration of your stay in the UK. Visa Application Online Application: Complete the online visa application form on the UK government website. Application Fee: Pay the visa application fee. As of now, the cost is Â£348. Biometric Information Biometric Appointment: Schedule and attend a biometric appointment to provide your fingerprints and a photograph. Supporting Documents Prepare the following supporting documents: CAS Number: Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies. Proof of Funds: Bank statements or financial sponsorship letters. English Language Proficiency: Test results. Tuberculosis Test Results: If applicable. Academic Documents: Certificates, transcripts, and any other academic qualifications. ATAS Certificate: If required for your course, an Academic Technology Approval Scheme (ATAS) certificate. Photographs: Passport-sized photos that meet UK visa requirements. Immigration History: Details of your previous travel and visa history, if applicable. Attend the Visa Interview (if required) Interview: Some students may be required to attend a credibility interview where you will be asked about your course, institution, finances, and plans after studying in the UK. After the Application Decision: Wait for a decision on your visa application. Processing times can vary, so apply well in advance of your course start date. BRP Collection: Once your visa is approved, collect your Biometric Residence Permit (BRP) within 10 days of your arrival in the UK. Tips for a Successful Application Apply Early: Start your visa application process as soon as you receive your CAS. Check Requirements: Ensure you meet all the requirements and provide accurate information. Prepare Documents: Gather all necessary documents in advance and ensure they meet the specified criteria. Seek Help: If you have any doubts, seek assistance from your universityâ€™s international office or a visa advisor. Scholarship Indian students have access to a variety of scholarships to study in the UK. These scholarships can significantly reduce the financial burden of studying abroad and are offered by the UK government, universities, and private organizations. Here is a detailed explanation of some prominent scholarships available: 1. Chevening Scholarships Description: Funded by the UK government, Chevening Scholarships are awarded to outstanding emerging leaders from around the world to pursue a one-year masterâ€™s degree in any subject at any UK university. Eligibility: Candidates must have at least two years of work experience and demonstrate leadership potential. Coverage: Full tuition fees, living expenses, and return airfare. 2. Commonwealth Scholarships Description: These scholarships are aimed at students from Commonwealth countries who would not otherwise be able to afford to study in the UK. They cover master's and PhD programs. Eligibility: Applicants must be from a Commonwealth country and demonstrate academic excellence. Coverage: Tuition fees, airfare, and a living allowance. 3. GREAT Scholarships Description: The British Council offers GREAT Scholarships in partnership with UK universities to students from various countries, including India. Eligibility: Each university has its own specific criteria, generally focused on academic excellence. Coverage: Scholarships worth Â£10,000 towards tuition fees for one-year postgraduate courses. 4. University-Specific Scholarships Many UK universities offer scholarships specifically for Indian students. Some notable examples include: Oxford India Centre for Sustainable Development Scholarships: For Indian students at the University of Oxford. Edinburgh Global Research Scholarships: For international students at the University of Edinburgh. Manchester India Partnership Scholarships: For Indian students at the University of Manchester. Post-Study Work Visa International students in the UK on a valid Tier 4 visa are allowed to stay in the country after finishing their education if they have a job offer worth at least GBP 20,800 per year. To stay in the UK, such students can move from a Tier 4 visa to a Tier 2 General visa with a five-year validity period. Students' post-study work experience will assist them in applying for permanent residence in the United Kingdom. Find a Course Find a University Blog Log in Sign Up Sign Up Home> Ireland Study in Ireland The Best Study Abroad Consultancy for Ireland Get free counselling | University and Course Selection | Application | Visa Process Top 500 QS World University Rankings 2 Years Graduate Visa (PSW) Â£13kâ€“Â£35k Annual Tuition Fees Up to Â£10,000 Scholarship on Tuition Fees 600K+ International Students Why Study in Ireland? Ireland is the greatest country to study in for Indian students who want to further their studies in Europe. Ireland has a reputation for academic quality, a beautiful landscape, kind people, and a rich tradition. There are numerous advantages to studying in Ireland. Because of the numerous opportunities offered to international students, it is a popular choice for many students. One of the primary advantages of studying in Ireland is that it has a well-regarded educational system that places a premium on skill development and entrepreneurial abilities. Hundreds of top U.S. companies have been established in Ireland due to low taxes, a highly qualified workforce, economic and political stability, and access to European markets and consumers. Benefits of Studying in the Ireland Education Quality Top Ranking Universities Affordable Tuition Fees Amazing Career Opportunities Friendly Culture Popular Courses Engineering & Technology Business Management Computer Science & AI Law Life Sciences Finance and Accounts Education & Training Arts, Design & Architecture Medicine & Health Admission Requirement Intake Cost Visa Requirements Scholarship Post-Study Work Visa Book a 1-on-1 chat with our Experts on Studying Abroad! +91 +44 +1 Select... Apply With Studytez By submitting you agree to our Terms and Privacy Policy. Admission Requirement Depending on the university you are applying to, admission criteria may vary. Moreover, the course you choose could also have additional prerequisites. Before beginning the application process, it is advisable to verify with your university and keep those documents handy. It is important to pay special attention to their application procedure, fees, and deadlines because different colleges may have different entrance standards and course offerings. Always apply at least 4-6 months before the last date to get a fair chance at consideration. Some of the mandatory documents asked by universities during the application process are: Proof of a minimum of 55%-75% in Graduation and 12th Grade Academic transcripts /Certificates English language tests such as IELTS, Duolingo or PTE are accepted Statement of Purpose (SOP) Letter of Recommendation Resume For Working Professionals: Offer letter and payslips Intake September Intake (Autumn/Fall Semester): The primary intake period, September intake, is the most popular among international students. It aligns with the start of the academic year in Ireland and offers a wide range of courses across various disciplines. Many universities open applications for the September intake several months in advance, often starting as early as the previous year. January Intake (Spring Semester): Some universities in Ireland also offer a January intake for certain courses. While not as common as the September intake, the January intake provides an additional opportunity for students who missed the September deadline or prefer to start their studies in the spring semester. The availability of courses for the January intake may vary depending on the institution and program. Cost Ireland is already stunning, and it gets even better with its affordability. Overseas students are drawn to Ireland because its tuition and living costs are significantly cheaper compared to other European nations. While there are schools and programs with expensive tuition, with the right research and guidance from counsellors, you can find an institution that suits your needs and financial situation. Tuition costs vary: For undergraduate programs, they generally range from â‚¬2,250 to â‚¬9,850, while for postgraduate programs, they range from â‚¬9,950 to â‚¬35,000. Many universities offer on-campus accommodation, but if it's too expensive, you can opt for private accommodation and share it with roommates to keep costs low. Additionally, students are allowed to work for up to 20 hours a week on their study permit, which can significantly help cover living expenses. Degree Average Cost in Euro Average Cost in INR Diploma â‚¬5,000 - â‚¬10,000 â‚¹9,50,000 - â‚¹28,50,000 Undergraduate Degree â‚¬10,000 - â‚¬25,000 â‚¹8,30,000 - â‚¹20,75,000 Postgraduate Degree â‚¬10,000 - â‚¬30,000 â‚¹8,30,000 - â‚¹25,00,000 PhD â‚¬12,000 - â‚¬35,000 â‚¹9,96,000 - â‚¹29,05,000 Visa Requirements Ireland Student Visa Requirements Applying for a student visa to study in Ireland involves meeting specific requirements and preparing various documents. Hereâ€™s a comprehensive guide to help you understand the process: 1. Acceptance to an Irish Educational Institution Acceptance Letter: Obtain an acceptance letter from a recognized Irish educational institution, confirming your enrollment in a full-time course. 2. Proof of Financial Support Proof of Funds: Demonstrate that you have sufficient funds to cover your tuition fees and living expenses for the duration of your studies. Generally, you need to show: â‚¬10,000 for each year of study, in addition to tuition fees. Bank statements, financial sponsorship letters, or evidence of educational loans can be used to show proof of funds. 3. Medical Insurance Health Insurance: Obtain private medical insurance that covers you for the duration of your stay in Ireland. 4. Passport Passport: A valid passport or travel document. Ensure your passport is valid for at least six months beyond your intended stay in Ireland. 5. Visa Application Form Online Application: Complete the online visa application form on the AVATS (Irish Naturalisation and Immigration Service's online visa application facility). Summary Form: Print and sign the summary form generated after you complete the online application. 6. Visa Application Fee Application Fee: Pay the non-refundable visa application fee. The fee can vary depending on the type of visa and the country of application. 7. Supporting Documents Prepare the following supporting documents: Application Summary Form: Signed summary form from the online application. Passport-Sized Photos: Two recent passport-sized photos that meet Irish visa requirements. Proof of Acceptance: Acceptance letter from the Irish educational institution. Proof of Funds: Bank statements or financial sponsorship letters. Health Insurance: Proof of medical insurance. Academic Documents: Transcripts, diplomas, degrees, or certificates from previous institutions. English Language Proficiency: Proof of English language proficiency through tests like IELTS or TOEFL, if required by the institution. Cover Letter: A cover letter explaining your study plans, your reasons for choosing Ireland, and your plans after completing the course. Proof of Payment of Tuition Fees: Receipts or bank statements showing payment of tuition fees, if applicable. 8. Biometrics and Photograph Biometrics: Provide your fingerprints and a photograph if required. This depends on the country you are applying from. 9. Submit the Application Submit Documents: Send your application and supporting documents to the appropriate visa office or embassy as directed in the application summary form. Processing Time: Processing times can vary, so apply well in advance of your course start date. 10. Attend the Visa Interview (if required) Interview: In some cases, you may be required to attend an interview with a visa officer. 11. Decision and Collection Decision Notification: You will be notified of the decision on your visa application. If approved, you will receive your passport with the visa stamp. Visa Collection: Collect your visa from the designated visa office or embassy. 12. Prepare for Departure Travel Arrangements: Make travel arrangements to Ireland. Documents for Travel: Keep your passport, visa, acceptance letter, proof of funds, and any other important documents in your carry-on luggage. 13. Arrival in Ireland Border Control: Present your documents to the immigration officer at the port of entry in Ireland. Registration with GNIB: If you are staying in Ireland for more than 90 days, you must register with the Garda National Immigration Bureau (GNIB) and obtain an Irish Residence Permit (IRP). Scholarship Government Scholarships: Government of Ireland International Education Scholarships: Offered by the Irish government to international students, including Indian students, to pursue a master's or PhD degree in Ireland. Covers a stipend of â‚¬10,000, full tuition fees, and other benefits. Applications are typically open annually, and selection is based on academic merit and potential contribution to Ireland's society. University Scholarships: Trinity College Dublin Scholarships: Trinity College Dublin offers various scholarships, including the Global Excellence Undergraduate Scholarship and the Trinity International Postgraduate Scholarship. These scholarships provide partial tuition fee waivers to outstanding international students, including those from India. Eligibility criteria and application procedures vary for each scholarship. University College Dublin (UCD) Scholarships: UCD offers scholarships such as the UCD Global Excellence Graduate Scholarships and the UCD Global Graduate Access Programme (GAP) Scholarships. These scholarships support international students, including Indian students, by providing financial assistance towards tuition fees or living expenses. Eligibility criteria and application processes differ for each scholarship. External Scholarships: Fulbright-Nehru Fellowships: Offered by the United States-India Educational Foundation (USIEF) and the U.S. Department of State's Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs. Provides opportunities for Indian students, scholars, and professionals to study, research, or teach in the United States and Ireland. Eligibility criteria and application procedures are specified by the Fulbright-Nehru Program. Commonwealth Scholarships: Administered by the Commonwealth Scholarship Commission in the United Kingdom (CSC). Available to Indian students for postgraduate study in Ireland under the Commonwealth Scholarship and Fellowship Plan (CSFP). Selection is based on academic merit and potential to contribute to the development of the home country. Institution-specific Scholarships: Dublin City University (DCU) Scholarships: DCU offers various scholarships, such as the DCU International Merit Scholarships, to attract high-achieving international students, including Indian students. These scholarships provide financial assistance towards tuition fees for undergraduate and postgraduate programs. Eligibility criteria and application procedures are outlined by the university. National University of Ireland, Galway (NUIG) Scholarships: NUIG offers scholarships like the India Global Excellence Scholarship to Indian students based on academic achievement. These scholarships aim to support Indian students in pursuing their academic goals at NUIG. Eligibility criteria and application details are provided by the university. Post-Study Work Visa Indian students studying in Ireland have access to excellent post-study work opportunities. Upon graduation, they can apply for the Third Level Graduate Scheme, allowing them to stay in Ireland for up to 24 months to seek employment or start their own business. Additionally, graduates may apply for work permits such as the Critical Skills Employment Permit or the General Employment Permit to secure jobs related to their field of study. Entrepreneurial-minded graduates can explore programs like the Start-up Entrepreneur Program or the Graduate Entrepreneur Visa to establish their businesses in Ireland. These post-study work options, coupled with networking opportunities and career support services, provide Indian students with a pathway to launch successful careers in Ireland after completing their studies. Australian qualifications are respected internationally when seeking employment or further study at leading international universities. Distinguishing Australia from many other countries is the Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF), which is a national system of leading pathways recognised throughout Australia and by other countries. Very friendly and cooperative people. Benefits of Studying in the Australia Australian cities are ranked as some of the most liveable in the world Four years of post-study work visa for select bachelorâ€™s degrees Five years of post-study work visa for select masterâ€™s degrees Part-time working hour is 40 to 48 hours per fortnight, from July 1, 2023 Australia is a technologically advanced country Popular Courses Engineering & Technology Business Management Computer Science & AI Law Life Sciences Finance and Accounts Education & Training Arts, Design & Architecture Medicine & Health Admission Requirement Intake Cost Visa Requirements Scholarship Post-Study Work Visa Book a 1-on-1 chat with our Experts on Studying Abroad! +91 +44 +1 Select... Apply With Studytez By submitting you agree to our Terms and Privacy Policy. Admission Requirement Graduate Diploma You must have achieved an undergraduate qualification equivalent to an Australian bachelor's degree. A minimum IELTS Academic score of 6.5 or a TOEFL score of at least 79 is required. Bachelor's Degree Secondary school qualification equivalent to an Australian Year 12 certificate. Minimum IELTS score of 6.0 or TOEFL score of 67. Statement of purpose. Master's Undergraduate qualification equivalent to a bachelor's degree, honours degree, or graduate diploma in Australia. IELTS Academic score of 6.5 or TOEFL score of 79. GRE/GMAT. References, statement of purpose, and resume. Proof of work experience. Doctorate Honours degree, master's degree by coursework with a research component, or an equivalent qualification from a recognised university. IELTS Academic score of 6.5 or TOEFL score of 79. Proof of work experience. Exams Required to Study at Australia Universities The exam requirements for studying in Australian universities can vary depending on the institution and the course of study. Here are some of the common exams that international students may be required to take: English Language Proficiency Tests (Undergraduate and Graduate): International English Language Testing System (IELTS) Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) Pearson Test of English (PTE) Cambridge English: Advanced (CAE) Intake Semester 1 (February/March Intake): This is the primary intake for most courses. It usually starts in late February or early March. The application deadlines for this intake typically fall between October and December of the previous year. Semester 2 (July Intake) This is the secondary intake and offers fewer course options compared to Semester 1. It usually starts in July. The application deadlines for this intake typically fall between April and May. Cost The cost of studying in Australia can vary depending on the level of education and the institution you choose to attend. The overall cost of studying can be divided into two categories: Tuition Fees and Cost of Living. Level of Education in Australia Costs for Indian students in AUD (Per year) Undergraduate Programs AUD 20,000 - 45,000 Postgraduate Programs AUD 22,000 - 50,000 PhD AUD 25,000- 55,000 Diploma AUD 10,000 - 25,000 Visa Requirements Australian Student Visa (Subclass 500) Requirements Confirmation of Enrollment (CoE) CoE: Obtain a Confirmation of Enrollment (CoE) from an Australian educational institution. This document confirms your enrollment in a course registered under the Commonwealth Register of Institutions and Courses for Overseas Students (CRICOS). Genuine Temporary Entrant (GTE) Requirement GTE Statement: Provide a statement that addresses your intention to stay in Australia temporarily for study purposes. This statement should include: Your ties to your home country. Reasons for choosing Australia and the specific course. Your career plans after completing the course. Financial Requirements Proof of Funds: Demonstrate that you have enough money to cover your tuition fees, living expenses, and travel costs. As of now, the living cost requirement is AUD 21,041 per year. Financial Documents: Bank statements, financial sponsorship letters, or evidence of educational loans can be used to show proof of funds. English Language Proficiency Test Scores: Provide proof of English language proficiency through approved tests like IELTS, TOEFL, PTE, or equivalent. Some exemptions may apply if you are from an English-speaking country or have completed previous studies in English. Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) Health Insurance: Obtain Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the duration of your stay in Australia. This health insurance is mandatory for international students. Health and Character Requirements Health Examination: Undergo a health examination if required. This depends on your country of residence and the duration of your stay. Character Requirements: Provide a police certificate to demonstrate good character. Valid Passport Passport: Ensure your passport is valid for the duration of your stay in Australia. Visa Application Online Application: Complete the online visa application form on the Department of Home Affairs website. Application Fee: Pay the visa application fee. As of now, the cost is AUD 650. Biometric Information Biometric Appointment: Schedule and attend a biometric appointment to provide your fingerprints and a photograph if required. Supporting Documents Prepare the following supporting documents: CoE: Confirmation of Enrollment. GTE Statement: Genuine Temporary Entrant statement. Proof of Funds: Bank statements or financial sponsorship letters. English Language Proficiency: Test results. OSHC: Proof of Overseas Student Health Cover. Health and Character Documents: Medical examination results and police certificates if applicable. Passport: Valid passport. Academic Documents: Certificates, transcripts, and any other academic qualifications. Photographs: Passport-sized photos that meet Australian visa requirements. Attend the Visa Interview (if required) Interview: Some students may be required to attend an interview to verify their application details. After the Application Decision: Wait for a decision on your visa application. Processing times can vary, so apply well in advance of your course start date. Visa Grant Notification: Once your visa is approved, you will receive a visa grant notification letter detailing your visa conditions. Tips for a Successful Application Apply Early: Start your visa application process as soon as you receive your CoE. Check Requirements: Ensure you meet all the requirements and provide accurate information. Prepare Documents: Gather all necessary documents in advance and ensure they meet the specified criteria. Seek Help: If you have any doubts, seek assistance from your universityâ€™s international office or a visa advisor. Scholarship Australian universities and the Australian government offer a variety of scholarships for Indian students to help cover the cost of tuition, living expenses, and other associated costs. Government Scholarships Australia Awards Scholarships: Funded by the Australian Government, these scholarships are available for students from developing countries, including India. They cover tuition fees, living expenses, and travel costs. Destination Australia Program: This scholarship aims to attract students to study in regional Australia. It provides financial support for both international and domestic students. University Scholarships Many Australian universities offer their scholarships to attract high-achieving international students. These scholarships can cover partial or full tuition fees and sometimes provide stipends for living expenses. Examples include: University of Sydney International Scholarships Melbourne International Undergraduate Scholarship Monash International Merit Scholarship Post-Study Work Visa Australia provides several post-study work opportunities for international students, including Indian students, to gain valuable work experience after completing their studies. These opportunities are primarily facilitated through the Temporary Graduate Visa (subclass 485), which has two streams: Temporary Graduate Visa (subclass 485) Graduate Work Stream Eligibility: Available to international students who have recently graduated with skills and qualifications that relate to an occupation on Australia's Skilled Occupation List (SOL). Duration: Up to 18 months. Work Rights: Allows graduates to work full-time in Australia. Application Period: Must be applied for within six months of completing your course. Additional Information: This stream is suitable for students who have completed qualifications such as diplomas and trade certificates. Post-Study Work Stream Eligibility: Available to international students who have recently graduated with a higher education degree (bachelorâ€™s, masterâ€™s, or doctoral) from an Australian institution, regardless of their field of study. Duration: Bachelorâ€™s degree: Up to 2 years Masterâ€™s by coursework: Up to 2 years Masterâ€™s by research: Up to 3 years Doctoral degree: Up to 4 years Work Rights: Allows graduates to work full-time in Australia. Application Period: Must be applied for within six months of completing your course. Additional Information: This stream is suitable for students who have completed higher education qualifications. ","isActive":true,"qualification":"Postgraduate","country":"UK","createdAt":"2025-04-14T07:46:21.202Z","updatedAt":"2025-09-20T12:01:35.192Z","courseId":"MSc-Artificial-Intelligence","isFavourite":true,"users":["6894e9885eeb35f26d9d672c"]},{"users":[],"_id":"6803d8cea2df6bb170d8a8a5","subjectId":"67fcbc018800f4cc034228d8","branchId":"67fcbc348800f4cc034228ed","title":"MSc Artificial Intelligence with Business Strategy","universityId":"67fcb7438800f4cc03422834","location":"Birmingham","rank":"423","fees":"23,500","duration":"1 year","score":"5.5","description":"

","isActive":true,"qualification":"Postgraduate","country":"UK","createdAt":"2025-04-19T17:09:34.956Z","updatedAt":"2025-09-20T10:08:47.771Z","courseId":"MSc-Artificial-Intelligence-with-Business-Strategy","isFavourite":false},{"users":[],"_id":"6803d9e47bb179142aab8594","subjectId":"67fcbc018800f4cc034228d8","branchId":"67fcbb4e8800f4cc034228cd","title":"MSc Business Analytics","universityId":"67fcb7438800f4cc03422834","location":"Birmingham","rank":"453","fees":"23,500","duration":"1 Year(s)","score":"5.5","description":"

In a data-rich society, every organisation needs analytical planning and big data analysis. This course has been designed to meet the growing demand from employers and will equip you with the skills to extract meaningful information from data to inform strategic decision-making.

Course outline and modules

From data mining and web analytics to business analytics in practise, our MSc Business Analytics will give you a comprehensive understanding of key areas of business analytics and develop your skills to meet the high demand from employers.

Attracting students from all over the world, this course is a great opportunity to mix with people from different cultures and with diverse backgrounds. You’ll enhance your communication, teamwork and management skills, whilst building a network of international contacts. It will also help you to appreciate the various approaches to people management in a multicultural context.

How will my skills develop?

We’ll develop your quantitative skills to identify trends and gain insights from complex data. You’ll also develop a clear understanding of the three types of data analytics – descriptive, predictive and prescriptive, and how to accurately analyse and visualise information as well as work with analytical tools.

All of this means you will become highly skilled at providing information to business leaders, improving commercial decision-making and business performance.

You’ll also study The Aston Global Advantage module which focuses on professional development and employability, helping you to apply the key skills that you will gain throughout the year.

You’ll also have the opportunity to study abroad with one of our international partners, undertake an internship placement in the UK or overseas or get involved in a global business challenge simulation.

Practical experience

We focus on the practical application of analytics in a business context, so you’ll discover what method, technique and tools can be used to solve specific commercial problems in the most effective way.

Many roles in business analytics are based in consultancies, so we will develop skills to help you excel in a consultancy environment, from working in a consultative role to understanding what good and bad consulting practice looks like.

","isActive":true,"qualification":"Postgraduate","country":"UK","createdAt":"2025-04-19T17:14:12.641Z","updatedAt":"2025-05-01T04:57:51.756Z","courseId":"MSc-Business-Analytics"},{"users":[],"_id":"681502909db57398181757b3","subjectId":"67fcbc018800f4cc034228d8","branchId":"67fcbc348800f4cc034228ed","courseId":"Bachelor-of-Commerce","title":"Bachelor of Commerce","universityId":"67fcb7be8800f4cc0342283e","location":"Melbourne","rank":"36","fees":"34930","duration":"3 Year(s)","score":"IELTS 6.5","description":"

About the Commerce

The Bachelor of Commerce has six majors you can choose from in your first or second year. You can even decide to do a double major, combining any two of Accounting, Economics, Finance, Marketing, and Management. Whether your aim is to work for a large financial consultancy, a tech startup or a social enterprise, the Bachelor of Commerce can take you straight into industry, further business and economics specialisation at Melbourne Business School, or a pathway to a range of graduate programs such as Law or Engineering.

A Melbourne commerce degree will give you the breadth, depth, and experience you need to be career-ready and join the workforce directly. Feel confident that your degree will take you further with our employer reputation, which is why we are ranked #8 for graduate employability worldwide (QS 2021).
Depending on your chosen major(s), the Bachelor of Commerce, together with other specified membership requirements, satisfies the accreditation requirements of a number of Australian professional associations. The benefits including access to industry networks, jobs, conferences, internationally recognised credentials and more. Visit the major pages to find out more about the accreditation bodies.

About Astron University

Astron University is a prestigious global institution dedicated to academic excellence, innovation, and research. It is renowned for offering cutting-edge education aligned with international standards.

Programs Offered

Astron University provides a wide range of programs including:

  • Undergraduate – Engineering, Business, Computer Science, Humanities

  • Postgraduate – Data Science, MBA, Biotechnology, Public Policy

  • Doctoral & Research – Advanced studies in multiple disciplines

Campus & Facilities

Located in a vibrant city, the campus features:

  • Modern classrooms and digital labs

  • Research centers and libraries

  • Student housing and recreation areas

  • Incubation centers for startups and innovation

Industry & Global Connections

Astron maintains strong partnerships with top industries and global universities.

  • Internship and placement support

  • Student exchange programs

  • International research collaborations

Scholarships & Financial Aid

Merit-based and need-based scholarships are available to help students from diverse backgrounds pursue quality education.

Career Support & Alumni Network

Students receive guidance through:

  • Career counseling services

  • Resume and interview workshops

  • Access to a successful alumni network worldwide

Vision & Mission

Astron University aims to nurture responsible leaders, innovators, and global citizens through transformative education and community-driven research.

","createdAt":"2025-04-14T07:21:29.310Z","updatedAt":"2025-04-14T07:21:29.310Z"},{"currency":{"country":"Australia","symbol":"A$","code":"AUD","name":"Australian Dollar"},"englishTests":[],"users":[],"_id":"67fcb7be8800f4cc0342283e","name":"University of Melbourne","location":"Melbourne","country":"Australia","uniId":"University-of-Melbourne","rank":"37","students":"21000","costOfLiving":"AUD963","images":[],"isActive":true,"details":"

Ranked among the top universities globally, it’s known for innovation, research, and global reach.

","createdAt":"2025-04-14T07:22:38.716Z","updatedAt":"2025-08-04T17:13:35.589Z","intake_month":["Jan"],"startingFee":"25000"},{"currency":{"country":"Canada","symbol":"C$","code":"CAD","name":"Canadian Dollar"},"users":[],"_id":"67fcb7fd8800f4cc03422843","name":"University of British Columbia","location":"Vancouver, Canada","country":"Canada","uniId":"University-of-British-Columbia","rank":"40","students":"18000","costOfLiving":"CAD542","images":["uploads/universityImages/f695eb49-71a7-4c1d-80f1-dababf4bdd06.jpg"],"isActive":true,"details":"

The University of British Columbia (UBC) is one of Canada’s oldest and most prestigious public research universities. Established in 1908, UBC has grown into a global centre for research, teaching, and learning, consistently ranked among the top 40 universities worldwide. With campuses in Vancouver and the Okanagan, UBC attracts over 60,000 students from more than 140 countries, fostering an inclusive and diverse academic environment.

UBC is renowned for its innovative approach to learning, interdisciplinary programs, and commitment to sustainability and community engagement. It offers a broad spectrum of undergraduate, graduate, and professional degree programs across disciplines such as Engineering, Arts, Science, Business, Forestry, and Health Sciences.

Students at UBC benefit from state-of-the-art facilities, vibrant campus life, extensive research opportunities, and strong connections with industries and communities around the world. The university’s location on Canada’s scenic West Coast provides students with unique recreational opportunities and a high quality of life.

Graduates from UBC are highly sought-after globally for their academic excellence, research capabilities, and leadership skills. UBC’s alumni network includes Nobel laureates, Rhodes Scholars, entrepreneurs, and global leaders.

Whether you are looking to pursue cutting-edge research, engage with world-class faculty, or enjoy one of Canada’s most beautiful campuses, UBC provides a transformative educational experience that helps shape leaders for a better world.

","createdAt":"2025-04-14T07:23:41.844Z","updatedAt":"2025-08-07T03:28:31.131Z","startingFee":"25123","intake_month":["Jan","Feb","Mar","April","May","June","Sep","July"],"cost":"
Expense Item Cost (CAD per Year)
Tuition (Undergraduate) $42,000 – $58,000
Tuition (Graduate) $9,000 – $22,000
Student Fees $1,200 – $1,500
Health Insurance $600 – $1,000
Books & Supplies $1,500 – $2,000
Housing & Meals $12,000 – $16,000
Personal Expenses $2,000 – $4,000
Total Estimated Cost $59,000 – $82,500

UBC’s tuition fees vary by program, with professional degrees such as Engineering, Commerce, or Computer Science tending toward the higher end. Living expenses depend on accommodation type and personal lifestyle.

The university offers various on-campus housing options ranging from residence halls to apartments, with meal plans included for most undergraduate residences.

Vancouver is one of Canada’s most desirable cities to live in, known for its high living standards and natural beauty, but students should budget accordingly for the cost of living.

Planning your finances in advance is crucial. UBC provides budgeting tools, guidance on working part-time while studying, and resources for finding affordable housing. Scholarships, grants, and assistantships can also help offset costs.

","requirements":"

The University of British Columbia has a competitive admissions process with clear academic and language requirements for international applicants. Here’s an overview of the general entry requirements:

Requirement Undergraduate Graduate
Academic Qualification High school diploma with strong grades (typically 85% or higher average) Bachelor’s degree with high standing (typically first-class or upper second)
Standardized Tests Not always required, but SAT/ACT may be requested (optional for many) GRE/GMAT may be required for some programs
English Language IELTS 6.5+ (no band below 6.0) or TOEFL iBT 90+ IELTS 6.5–7.5 or TOEFL iBT 90–100+
Additional Documents Personal profile, references, portfolios (for some programs) Letters of recommendation, statement of intent, research proposal
Application Deadlines January 15 (undergraduate) Varies by program (often December–January)

UBC seeks well-rounded students who demonstrate academic excellence, leadership, and community involvement. For undergraduate applicants, the personal profile is a critical component where students highlight achievements, volunteer work, and unique experiences.

Graduate applicants are evaluated on academic transcripts, research interests, supervisor availability, and fit with the program. Many research-based programs expect students to connect with potential supervisors before applying.

It’s important to check individual program pages for specific prerequisites, portfolio requirements, or additional tests. Applicants should start preparing well in advance to gather required documents and meet deadlines. UBC’s admissions website offers detailed guidance and advisors are available to help applicants navigate the process smoothly.

","scholarship":"
Scholarship Name Value (CAD) Eligibility
International Major Entrance Scholarship (IMES) Up to $40,000 High academic achievement for first-year students
Outstanding International Student Award (OIS) $5,000 – $10,000 Exceptional academic achievement
UBC Graduate Fellowship (UGF) $18,200 Research-based Master’s and Doctoral students
Donald A. Wehrung International Student Award Full cost coverage Students from impoverished or war-torn regions
UBC Public Scholars Initiative (PSI) $10,000 per year Doctoral students engaged in impactful research
Vanier Canada Graduate Scholarship $50,000 per year Top-tier doctoral candidates

UBC’s scholarships recognize academic excellence, leadership, and community service. Some awards are automatically considered upon admission, while others require separate applications.

In addition to university-administered scholarships, students may explore external funding opportunities, research assistantships, and teaching assistantships.

It’s strongly recommended to apply early and review eligibility criteria carefully. UBC’s financial aid advisors can guide students through the process and help identify funding sources to make studying at UBC more affordable and accessible.
